doc.abstracts: In April 1991, Visvanathan Rajagopalan was interviewed by the Brookings Institution on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by Richard Webb and Devesh Kapur. During his tenure at the Bank from 1965 to 1994, Mr. Rajagopalan worked in the following areas: in the public utilities department as a sanitary engineer for the water supply division (1969-1972) and as deputy division chief (1972); in the Asia projects department as section chief for the public utilities division (1972-1973) and as division chief for the water supply division (1974-1975); in the South Asia projects department as assistant director (1975-1979) and as director of the project advisory staff for central projects (1979-1982); in the projects policy department as director (1982-1986); for the Europe, Middle East and North Africa (EMENA) region as director of the projects department (1986-1987); as vice president for sector policy research (1987-1991) and for sector and operations policy (1991-1992); as chairman for the Consultative Group on International Agricultural Research (CGIAR) (1991-1993); and as vice president and as special advisor in the office of the president (1993-1994). He created a department called the projects advisory staff, later known as the projects policy department, and also the project preparation facility. His transcript concerns loan documents, the origin of the operational manual statements, other operational policies, and the annual review of development effectiveness.
